description: The Atelier has been unlocked.
name: Atelier Unlocked

description: Recipes have been unlocked.
name: Recipes Unlocked

description: Quests have been unlocked.
name: Quests Unlocked

description: Growboards and Glowing Orb Quests have been unlocked.
name: Growboards Unlocked

description:
Dungeons have been unlocked. 
You can find synthesis materials in dungeons.
name: Dungeons Unlocked

description: Piece Quests have been unlocked. You can select these through the Training Quests at Quests.
name: Piece Quests Unlocked

description: Research has been unlocked. You can select it at the Atelier.
name: Unlocking Research

description: Secret Quests have been unlocked. You can select them at Quests.
name: Unlocking Secret Quests

description:
Training Research has been unlocked.
You can access it from the Atelier's Research section.
name: Training Research Unlocked

description: You can unlock new recipes when you meet certain conditions. You will also earn rewards when unlocking new recipes. Tap on the recipe icons to check the Idea Requirements for each recipe.
name: Recipes

description: There are also rewards based on the total number of recipes you have unlocked.
name: Total Recipe Rewards

description: There are rewards for obtaining recipes, as well as rewards based on the total number of recipes you have obtained.
name: Recipes Rewards

description: Here, you can change the characters in your party and the battle items that you take with you into battle. Tap on a selected character or the + button to change the characters in your party.
name: Editing Your Party

description: You can select one character as the leader of your party. The leader will activate their Leader Skill, increasing the strength of your party. You can change your leader at any time you can change your party lineup.
name: Leader

description: Tap the button on the top right of the screen to change your Characters' equipment. Any equipment changed here will not affect other parties.
name: Equipment

description: By using the "Saved Set" button on the far right of the equipment change dialog, you can load and equip a saved set of Memoria and equipment.
name: Saved Set

description: Tap the button on the lower left of the screen to select the battle items you will take into battle. Normal quests and dungeons will allow for different quantities.
name: Editing Your Items

description: By tapping the Auto Select button, you can automatically select characters, items, and equipment for your party.
name: Auto Select

description: You can swap between 10 different party setups for normal quests and dungeons. You can switch parties by tapping the tabs on the top right of the screen.
name: Swapping Parties

description: Here, you can check character information, level them up through Training, as well as change their equipment.
name: Character List

description: The Training tab allows you to check the stats of each character, as well as level them up or Awaken them.
name: Training Characters

description: To level up a character, you need Cole and Experience Candy. On the Level Up screen, you can select Experience Candies to level up the character of your choice.
name: Leveling Up Characters

description: You can Awaken a character by using a certain amount of that character's Pieces. Awakening has several benefits, such as raising character stats, unlocking abilities, and leveling up their burst skill.
name: How to Awaken Characters

description:
By using an Elixir of Return and partially resetting your character's training, you can gain items based on the progress made so far.
Note: Resetting will affect the progress of missions and recipes.
name: Character Training Reset

description: Selecting the Reset Level Only option allows you to reset level progression while keeping the board unlock status unchanged.
name: Reset Level Only

description: On the Equipment tab, you can check and swap your characters' equipment and Memoria.
name: Equipment

description: Equip All allows you to automatically select equipment and Memoria from those you currently possess. The Remove function will remove all the equipment and Memoria that you currently have equipped.
name: Equip All/Remove

description: Equipping a Memoria to a character will raise their stats. Different Memoria will raise different stats, and leveling a Memoria will alter the bonuses it gives.
name: Improving Stats with Memorias

description: Each Memoria has an associated ability. Keep each character's role and attribute affinities in mind when choosing which Memoria to equip.
name: Obtaining Abilities with Memorias

description: Characters can equip 1 of each of the 3 types of equipment: weapons, armor, and accessories.
name: Equipment

description: Equipping items increases a character's stats and gives them access to their traits and effects. Keep character roles and attribute affinities in mind when choosing the most appropriate items.
name: Equipped Item Effects

description: Tap the Recommended checkbox to display only the equipment and Memoria that are suitable for the currently selected character.
name: Display Recommended

description: The equipment you set here will be equipped when the character is added to the party lineup. Make sure to set equipment that suits the character.
name: Character Equipment and Party Equipment

description: On the Board tab, you can enhance characters by unlocking their panels.
name: Growboards

description: By unlocking panels, you can increase character stats, level up their skills, and increase their maximum level. Cole and Glowing Orbs are required to unlock panels.
name: Growboards - Unlocking Panels

description: Once you've unlocked all the panels on a board, you'll be able to move to the next board. Boards are added as you progress through the main story.
name: Growboards - Unlocking Boards

description: The Glowing Orbs needed to unlock panels can be acquired by going on the Glowing Orb Quests that you can find listed under Training Quests. You can also gain Glowing Orbs during synthesis.
name: Collecting Glowing Orbs

description: You can unlock a character's EX Board using Sacred Orbs. Once you unlock an EX Board, you can begin to unlock panels on the board. Sacred Orbs are rare materials, so use them with care.
name: About EX Boards

description: Here you can check the Memoria that you currently own. Tap on a Memoria to see its details.
name: Memoria List

description: On the Details screen you can check the stats and abilities of a Memoria. You can also level up and unlock it.
name: Memoria Detail Screen

description: To level up a Memoria, you need Cole and power up materials. On the Level Up screen, you can select Power Up Dew and other Memoria to increase the level of the selected Memoria.
name: Leveling Up Memoria

description: You can obtain Power Up Dew by completing Power Up Dew Quests, which you can find under Training Quests.
name: Collecting Power Up Dew

description: You can unlock Memoria by consuming Memorias with the same name. Unlocking Memoria enhances their abilities.
name: Unlocking Memoria

description: The rewards you receive improve based on your score. Your score is calculated based on the actions you take during battles.
name: Score Battles

description: On the Results screen, you can see which items you were graded on and their score. You will be ranked based on your score, with higher rankings giving better rewards.
name: Ranks and Rewards

description: When you perform Swift Hunt in a Score Battle, you will automatically receive the highest rank you previously earned for that battle.
name: Ranks and Rewards

description: You will need to spend stamina to explore dungeons. In dungeons, you will fight different enemies in multiple battles, with your HP carrying over each battle. The strength of enemies and materials you can obtain will vary depending on the difficulty level.
name: Dungeons

description: Swipe Right: Move forward. Swipe Left: Go back. Tap the auto button on the top right of the screen to move automatically.
name: Dungeons: Basic Controls

description: Each dungeon has three Blessings. A Blessing will give you its indicated effect that can turn battles in your favor as you progress through dungeons.
name: Dungeons: Positive Effects

description: You will find Gathering Points in dungeons. Tap the Gathering Tool icon to gather synthesis materials.
name: Dungeons: Gathering

description: You will encounter enemies while moving through a dungeon. You will need to defeat them to progress further.
name: Dungeons: Battles

description: At the end of each dungeon, a boss guards the exit. You must defeat the boss to clear the dungeon.
name: Dungeons: Bosses

description: Clearing a dungeon will unlock the Swift Gather feature. This allows you to spend stamina to collect rewards from the dungeon without having to explore it manually.
name: Dungeon Swift Gather

description: Start on the 1st floor and work your way up by clearing battles. Higher floors have stronger enemies. You can take this challenge as many times as you want, without spending stamina.
name: The Elemental Tower

description: Each floor has various Floor Effects that will be active during battles on that floor. Each floor is different, and you can check the current effects during battle.
name: Floor Effects

description: You can obtain rare items such as Lodestar Gems and Sacred Orbs when you clear floors in the Elemental Tower. The higher you go, the better the rewards.
name: Clear Rewards

description: Training Quests reward you with various materials that will help strengthen your characters and Memoria.
name: Training Quests

description: Each Training Quest involves various battle missions. After clearing all of the missions one time, you will be able to skip them.
name: Battle Missions

description: All Training Quests other than Piece Quests give daily bonuses up to 3 times a day. Daily bonuses increase the rewards that you get from each quest.
name: Daily Bonuses

description: These quests give large amounts of Cole, which is used to enhance characters and conduct research.
name: Cole Quests

description: These quests give large amounts of experience to your characters when you clear them.
name: EXP Quests

description: These quests reward you with Power Up Dew, which is required to level up Memorias.
name: Power Up Dew Quests

description: These quests reward you with Glowing Orbs, which you will need to power up Growboards.
name: Glowing Orb Quests

description: There are 6 types of Glowing Orb Quests: Red, Yellow, Blue, Green, Purple, and All. You can challenge any of the quests at any time.
name: Selecting Glowing Orbs

description: These quests reward you with the Pieces that you need to Awaken characters. Normally, you can only do these quests 3 times per day, but spending Lodestar Gems will allow you to challenge them an additional 2 times.
name: Piece Quests

description: When you clear a quest, you will receive Pieces for the characters in your party. Use characters that you want to power up when you take on these quests!
name: Piece Quests

description: At the Star's Cocoon, you can accept quests offered by Ryza and the other cafe staff.
name: Quests

description: Most quests require you to spend stamina. Spent stamina restores over time.
name: Stamina

description: Obtain materials that will help enhance your characters and Memorias.
name: Training Quests

description: Gather materials used in synthesis. These quests are split into 2 types: Score Battles and Dungeons.
name: Material Quests

description: These quests will give you a special challenge. Start on the 1st floor of the Elemental Tower and work your way to the top. The higher the floor, the stronger the enemies you will face.
name: Secret Quests

description: You can recover stamina by receiving pies from Rorona. You can receive 2 pies per day.
name: Orders

description: You can order pies from Rorona. Each pie will recover 100 stamina.
name: Orders

description: Pies will finish baking at 11:00 and 17:00 (UTC+8) every day. You can store up to 2 pies, but any stored pies unclaimed by 10:59 (UTC+8) the following day will disappear.
name: Obtaining Pies

description: Here, you can take on battles and see the stories from various Events.
name: Event Stories

description: You will receive First-Time Rewards the first time you see an Event story or clear an Event battle.
name: First-Time Rewards

description: This is a limited-time event dungeon that requires a Challenge Ticket to enter. Check the details for each Event to see how to obtain Challenge Tickets.
name: Event Dungeons

description: There are some synthesis materials that can only be obtained during limited-time events. These materials are usually used for limited-time event recipes, so make sure to gather them whenever you can.
name: Gatherable Synthesis Materials

description: This content requires a Challenge Ticket to enter. Check the details for each Event to see how to obtain Challenge Tickets.
name: Event Score Battles

description:
Your rank is determined by the score that you get based on your battle performance. 
Enemies will drop rewards after battles that are based on your current rank. When you perform Swift Hunting, your highest past rank will be referenced.
name: Drop Rewards

description: This content requires a Challenge Ticket to enter, and will place you against powerful enemies. Check the details for each Event to see how to obtain Challenge Tickets.
name: Boss Challenges

description:
Your rank is determined by the score that you get based on your battle performance. 
Enemies will drop rewards after battles that are based on your current rank. When you perform Swift Hunting, your highest past rank will be referenced.
name: Drop Rewards

description: These quests have special rewards for reaching certain ranks. Each time you go up a rank, you will receive a Rank Clear Reward. Tap the treasure box icon to receive your rewards.
name: Rank Clear Rewards

description: EX Challenges are extremely difficult battles against super powerful foes.
name: EX Challenges

description: You will not receive reward drops after EX Challenge battles. Instead, you will be given Rank Rewards when your rank goes up.
name: Rewards

description: You can conduct Synthesis at the Atelier. Convert and Research are also available here.
name: About the Atelier

description: Synthesis allows you to use materials and mana to create battle items that can be used in combat and equipment that can be used by your characters.
name: Synthesis

description: You can see the items you can synthesize and their required materials on the left side of the screen. On the right side, you can use the tabs to find the type of item you want to synthesize. Then, tap the Recipe icon to select.
name: Selecting a Recipe

description:
Simple synthesis allows you to perform synthesis without needing to select a lineup. You can bulk synthesize up to 100 times depending on the amount of mana and materials you have.
The traits on items are randomly selected from a set of random traits.
name: Simple Synthesis

description: Filter by affinity or role to display recommended recipes. Simply select an attribute and/or role and press the Confirm button to show recipes suitable for the relevant character.
name: Search Recommended Recipes

description: By selecting which character performs the synthesis and which materials are used, you can add special traits to the synthesized items. Traits give items various effects.
name: Preparing to Synthesize

description: You can select the characters and materials for each synthesis by dragging and dropping their icons to the middle of the screen, or by tapping on them.
name: Selecting Characters and Materials

description: All recipes, characters, and synthesis materials have an associated Gift Color. By linking the same colors, you can reveal traits that will be applied to the item that you are creating.
name: Gift Colors and Revealing Traits

description: The traits applied to a synthesized item will be chosen randomly from the traits revealed during synthesis. Each trait will also have a random trait level. Battle items can have a total of 3 traits, while equipment can have 2.
name: Trait Application and Trait Levels

description: There are two types of traits: battle item traits, and equipment traits. Synthesis materials will all have traits of one type or the other. When synthesizing battle items, you can choose to use only materials with battle item traits.
name: Trait Types

description: Each item created through synthesis has a Quality assigned to it. The higher the compatibility of the traits are on the item, the higher the quality value will be.
name: Quality

description: You can convert synthesized items into Shiny Coins. The amount of Shiny Coins that you will receive changes according to the rarity and trait Levels of the synthesized item.
name: Item Conversion

description: Shiny Coins can be exchanged for other items in the Shop.
name: Using Shiny Coins

description:
Here you can use Cole or Shiny Coins to strengthen your characters and items.
There are three types of research: Battle Research, Alchemy Research, and Training Research.
name: Research

description: Combat Research allows you to power up the specialties of each role. Through research, you can obtain effects such as HP Up and Dealt Damage Up.
name: Combat Research

description: Alchemy Research allows you to power up the specialties of battle items and equipment. Through research, you can improve the effects of battle items and the stats on equipment, among other things.
name: Alchemy Research

description:
Training Research allows you to raise the minimum character level.
Example: If the minimum character level is 50,
a level 10 character can be fielded as if they are level 50.
name: Training Research

description:
Tap the Research Effects List button to
view a list of all the research effects you have obtained.
name: Check Obtained Effects

description: Ryza's Challenge is a cooperative mission experience in which players share progress and take on challenges together.
name: Ryza's Challenge

description:
As you complete each challenge level, you can earn a selection of rewards, including exclusive recipes.
Please refer to the announcements for more details.
name: Ryza's Challenge Rewards

description:
Each time you exchange, you will receive some of the contents from the Box,
and eventually you will be able to obtain all of the items inside.
You can check what's inside the Box from the Box List.
name: About Event Boon Boxes

description:
Once you have emptied the contents of the Box, you will move to the next Box,
and all items will be replaced.
name: Replacing Boxes

description:
Emblems can be earned by fulfilling specific conditions.
Each emblem has a unique effect that is activated simply by possessing the emblem.
name: What are Emblems?

description: The higher the rarity of an emblem, the stronger its effect. If you have multiple emblems of the same type, only the highest effect will be applied.
name: Emblem Effects

description:
By selecting a location and characters for exploration, you can automatically collect various items over time.
Collected items can be received using the "Obtain" button on the home screen.
name: Exploration

description: As you progress through the main story, more locations will become available.
name: Location Selection

description:
The items that drop and the chances of them dropping vary based on the following:
- Score Battle completion status
- Player Rank
name: Dropped Items

description: Each location has recommended Top Pick Characters. Always try to send them to these locations to get a higher lineup bonus.
name: Top Pick Characters

description:
The exploration lineup is made up of the characters you select to explore a location. 
Depending on the characters you select, you can improve the efficiency of acquiring items and earn bonus items.
name: Exploration Lineup

description:
In addition to using Top Pick Characters, 
the bonus also varies based on the awakening level of each character.
name: Lineup Bonus

description:
Revival Events are events that were playable in the past and have become available again. 
If you participated in the event in the past, you can continue from where you left off. 
It's also possible to obtain recipes and materials that were only available from the event.
name: What's a Revival Event?

description: You'll need a Key of Memories to unlock the event. One Key of Memories is needed to unlock one event. Keys of Memories can be obtained from many places, such as event rewards.
name: How to Play Revival Events

description: Challenging a Revival Event will consume stamina instead of challenge tickets.
name: Difference between Revival Events and Standard Events

description: Here, you can take on battles and see the stories from various events.
name: Event Stories (Revival)

description:
The first time you view a story or clear a battle, you can obtain First-Time Rewards.
Note: You will not receive First-Time Rewards if you already received them when the event was previously run.
name: First-Time Rewards

description: Revival Events require the use of Stamina to enter the event dungeon. You will still be able to obtain synthesis materials during Revival Events that were previously only available in limited-time events.
name: Event Dungeon (Revival)

description: You can challenge Score Battles in Revival Events by using stamina. If you participated in the event in the past, your Clear and Rank statuses will carry over when playing again.
name: Event Score Battles (Revival)

description:
Your rank is determined by the score that you get based on your battle performance. 
Enemies will drop rewards after battles that are based on your current rank. When you perform Swift Hunting, your highest past rank will be referenced.
name: Drop Rewards

description: Take on Boss Challenges in Revival Events by using stamina. If you participated in the event in the past, your Clear status, Rank status, and obtained Rank Clear Rewards will carry over when playing again.
name: Boss Challenges (Revival)

description:
Your rank is determined by the score that you get based on your battle performance. 
Enemies will drop rewards after battles that are based on your current rank. When you perform Swift Hunting, your highest past rank will be referenced.
name: Drop Rewards

description: These quests have special rewards for reaching certain ranks. Each time you go up a rank, you will receive a Rank Clear Reward. Tap the treasure box icon to receive your rewards.
name: Rank Clear Rewards

description: EX Challenges are extremely difficult battles against very powerful foes. If you participated in the event in the past, your Clear status, Rank status, and obtained Rank Clear Rewards will carry over when playing again.
name: EX Challenges (Revival)

description: You will not receive reward drops after EX Challenge battles. Instead, you will be given Rank Rewards when your rank goes up.
name: Rewards

description: These are special boss challenges that are unlocked over time. These battles feature enemies with unique changes from standard battles and offer specific conditions that can significantly increase your score.
name: SP Challenge

description: In this game mode, you use synthesis items to aim for higher scores. Depending on the scores you achieve, you can earn various rewards.
name: Item Challenge

description:
Changing the items used increases the performance parameters, which vary depending on the type and traits of the items.
Parameters that are considered more important will be highlighted.
name: Parameters

description: Each Item Challenge has designated items that can be used.These items can more effectively boost parameters, so use them wisely to aim for a high score.
name: Special Effects

description: Roman's Grand Tournament is a regularly held battle event. Your ranking changes based on your total damage dealt, and you can earn various rewards depending on your ranking.
name: Roman's Grand Tournament

description:
Battles in this event have a turn limit. When the remaining turns reach 0, the battle ends and total damage is tallied.
Note: Total damage is recorded regardless of victory or defeat.
name: Special Battle Rules

description: The actual measure of damage is not the amount of damage dealt, but the amount of enemy HP reduced. Therefore, any damage that exceeds the enemy's maximum HP will not be counted.
name: Total Damage Measurement

description: The highest difficulty battles feature enemies with infinite HP. Here, you simply need to maximize your total damage within the specified number of turns.
name: High Difficulty Battles

description: After the event period ends, you will receive rewards based on your rank. Ranking rewards will be distributed via Mail after you log back in once the event has ended.
name: Ranking Rewards

description: At the Beach House, you can enjoy a selection of content including stories and battles. Over time you will also automatically collect items at the Beach House. You can use the items to take on certain challenges.
name: Beach House

description: You can upgrade the Beach House level from the button in the upper left corner. As the Beach House level increases, items will be collected at a more efficient rate. It might also unlock some new features, or even change the appearance of the Beach House!
name: LEVEL UP

description:
The Item Rental system allows you to rent out synthesis items to customers and receive Beach House Rental Coins as a reward at 11:00 (UTC+8) the next day.
Note: Rental Items will not be consumed, and can also still be used in battle.
name: Item Rental

description: Item Rental also has trends. Renting items that are trending will give you additional bonuses when you receive your rewards.
name: Trend Bonus

description:
Note that if you start rentals without filling all rental slots, you will not be able to add items to the empty slots until the rental period ends.
Note: Rentals cannot be canceled once started, so be careful when starting your rentals.
name: Cautions for Item Rental

description: Beach Flag Race is a turn-attack dungeon where your rank is determined by the total number of turns taken to clear the dungeon. There are no Gathering Points, and rewards are based on your rank.
name: Beach Flag Race

description: Beach Flag Races can be taken on by using challenge attempts. Even after completing the dungeon, if you're not satisfied with the results, you can exit and retry without consuming an attempt.
name: Attempts

description: In Beach Flag Race, you can battle with a team lineup of your choice, but the runner in the dungeon will be Resna in her swimsuit. However, if some of her friends are also in swimsuits, the runner might change!
name: Beach Flag Runners

description: You can now set different equipment for each party! Use the button in the top right to change the equipment of the characters in your current lineup.
name: Party Equipment Feature Added!

description:
On the Equip All screen, you can change the equipment for characters in your party lineup.
Note: Equipment changes made here won't affect other parties.
name: Equip All Screen

description: You can also now save your favorite combinations of Memoria and equipment to Saved Sets, allowing you to quickly load them when needed.
name: Saved Set

description: While editing a party lineup, you can open the Equip All screen by tapping the Equip button at the bottom of the screen.
name: Equipment in the Party Lineup Screen

description: When you add a character to a party lineup, their initial equipment will be the equipment set on their Character screen.
name: Character Equipment and Party Equipment

description: Enjoy stories with the Characters you have unlocked.
name: Bonds

description:
A Key of Friendship is required to unlock the stories of a Character whose stories are still locked.
Keys of Friendship are primarily obtained as a reward for Weekly Missions.
name: Unlocking Stories

description: Each story has specific conditions that must be met to unlock it. Once these conditions are met, you'll be able to view the story.
name: Story Unlock Conditions

description: In Chapter 3, you can turn Photo Mode on during the story by tapping the camera icon in the top left corner.
name: Chapter 3: Turn Photo Mode On

description:
While Photo Mode is turned on, you can move the camera and zoom in and out.
Note: Camera movement is only available while zoomed in.
name: Chapter 3: Photo Mode Features

description: In Chapter 4, you will be offered choices during the story that will change the ending and unlock Chapter 5. If the character has a poor reaction to your choice, try again with a different choice.
name: Chapter 4: Choices

description: In Chapter 5, you'll get to watch a special Memorial Scene to commemorate the character's story. These Memorial Scenes can be set as your home screen background after you view them.
name: Chapter 5: Memorial Scene

description:
- Marie's strength lies in the damage of her Skill 2!
- However, the same skill also lowers her own skill damage.
Note: Trial battles are played with a max level, fully awakened party with
fully unlocked Growboards.
name: Marie "Fortune Full Bloom" Ice | Attacker

description:
-  Use Skill 1 to remove negative effects on Marie, as well as boost her critical rate by 100% for the next turn!
- Skill 2 increases critical damage by 20% before attacking!
name: Marie "Fortune Full Bloom" Ice | Attacker

description:
Burst Skill removes all negative effects and status effects from self
and also grants immunity to negative effects for 3 turns!
name: Marie "Fortune Full Bloom" Ice | Attacker

description:
- How to Fight -
- Use Skill 2 to deal tons of damage to the enemy!
- Use her other skills to remove the negative effects caused by Skill 2!
name: Marie "Fortune Full Bloom" Ice | Attacker

description:
Has an ability that boosts the potency of damage buffs given to and received by self by 20%! Also boosts the effects received from positive panels by 30%!
Note: Trial battles are played with a max level, fully awakened party with fully unlocked Growboards.
name: Marie "Violent Beauty" Bolt | Attacker

description: Skill 2 boosts all allied Attackers' critical rate by 20% (MAX 100%) and critical damage by 10%! (MAX 50%)
name: Marie "Violent Beauty" Bolt | Attacker

description: When Burst Skill is a critical attack, it will convert the next ally on the timeline's panel into a burst panel! This attack's critical damage is also boosted by 50%!
name: Marie "Violent Beauty" Bolt | Attacker

description:
- How to Fight -
- Use Skill 2 to enhance the critical attacks of allied Attackers!
- Get critical attacks with Marie's Burst Skill to generate burst panels!
name: Marie "Violent Beauty" Bolt | Attacker

description:
Has an ability that boosts own M. ATK by 10% when defeating an enemy with a skill (MAX 30%) and another that boosts own skill damage by 20% when attack target is stunned! (MAX 60%)
Note: Trial battles are played with a max level, fully awakened party with fully unlocked Growboards.
name: Marie "Bomber Cat" Ice | Attacker

description: Skill 2 boosts the attack's damage by 40% to targets that are stunned. After attacking, it also boosts own skill damage by 20% for 2 turns and boosts the target's stun damage received by 20% for 2 attacks!
name: Marie "Bomber Cat" Ice | Attacker

description: Burst Skill boosts the attack's damage by 50% to targets that are stunned! Before attacking, it also boosts own skill damage by 50% (MAX 100%), and after attacking, converts next panel for self into a boost+ panel! (Excludes burst panels)
name: Marie "Bomber Cat" Ice | Attacker

description:
- How to Fight -
Make use of skills and abilities to deal boosted damage to enemies! Use Skill 2 and Burst Skill to deal huge damage to stunned enemies!
name: Marie "Bomber Cat" Ice | Attacker

description:
Has an ability that boosts own M. ATK by 10% after using a skill (MAX 50%) and another that boosts potency of damage buffs given and received by self by 20%!
Note: Trial battles are played with a max level, fully awakened party with fully unlocked Growboards.
name: Judie "Heroic Assault" Fire | Attacker

description: After attacking with Skill 2, boosts all allied Attackers' critical rates by 20% (MAX 100%) and critical damage by 10%! (MAX 50%)
name: Judie "Heroic Assault" Fire | Attacker

description: When Burst Skill is a critical attack, it converts the next ally on the timeline's panel into a burst panel! After attacking, it also boosts all enemies' critical damage received by 30%!
name: Judie "Heroic Assault" Fire | Attacker

description:
- How to Fight -
- Use Skill 2 to boost all allied Attackers' critical attacks!
- Critically attack with the Burst Skill to create a burst panel for an ally!
name: Judie "Heroic Assault" Fire | Attacker

description:
- Skill 2 boosts an ally's critical rate by 100% on their next turn!
- Her ability boosts all allies' skill damage by 20%!
Note: Trial battles are played with a max level, fully awakened party with
fully unlocked Growboards.
name: Rorona "Falling Snow" Slash | Supporter

description:
Burst Skill boosts all allies' P. ATK by 15% (MAX 30%) and also restores their HP by 30%!
Note: These numbers reflect HP recovery amount at skill level 5.
name: Rorona "Falling Snow" Slash | Supporter

description:
- How to Fight - 
- Use Skill 2 to boost the critical rate of an ally!
- Use Burst Skill to boost all allies' P. ATK, supporting allies' attacks in battle.
name: Rorona "Falling Snow" Slash | Supporter

description:
The ability "Kitty Cat Team" grants her immunity to negative panels, while also boosting the potency of the positive panels she uses by 10%!
Note: Trial battles are played with a max level, fully awakened party with fully unlocked Growboards.
name: Rorona "Joyful Leader" Strike | Supporter

description:
Skill 2 will convert the next ally on the timeline's panel into a burst panel! 
Plus, it boosts the skill damage of all allies!
